711519f-a.text:
East 19th Street, at, adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of First Ave. Shown at Nos. 404-408, is the Christus Kirche (Christ Church), German Lutheran, organized in 1898; the building being erected in 1869.
July 7, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

711516f-a.text:
19th Street, south side, west from No. 352, just west of First Avenue. The row of four-story buildings in the foreground, Nos. 352-336, were built around 1860. The three six-story apartment houses in the centre went up about 1900. No. 242 East 19th Street, the 15-story apartment house on the s.w. corner of Second Avenue, was built between 1925 and 1928.
July 7, 1928
P.L. Sperr.
No Reproductions

711515f-a.text:
402 and 404-8 East 19th Street, adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of First Ave., showing Christus Kirche (Christ Church), a German Lutheran organization in what was a derman locality prior to the early 1900's.
December 3, 1937.
George D. Chinn.

711517f-a.text:
"L" demolition.  7-18-1942

P.L. Sperr, photographer

Neg. A607

711518f-a.text:
N. End 14 St. & 1 Ave. "L" Sta.
6-13-42

Neg. No. A_508

P.L. Sperr
